title: Claims Adjuster- Casualty Coverage and Mass Tort Department
description:
Casualty Coverage and Mass Tort Claims Adjuster
  
  

At AIG, we are reimagining the way we help customers to manage risk. Join us as a Casualty Coverage and Mass Tort Claims Adjuster to play your part in that transformation. You’ll work with some of the best claims and underwriting minds in the industry addressing challenging claims and sophisticated coverage issues, and helping our businesses develop products to address the rapidly evolving risk environment. Grow your career at the forefront of Casualty insurance.
  
  

In Casualty Coverage and Mass Tort Claims, we strive to live AIG’s corporate values: Take Ownership, Set the Standard, Win Together, Be an Ally, Do What’s Right. At AIG, we are committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
  
  

Make your mark in Casualty Claims
  
  

In this entry level role, you’ll deal with sophisticated litigation and coverage issues, including long-tail bodily injury and property damage exposures, claims arising under Coverage B of Primary/Excess CGL policies, construction defect, as well as environmental and toxic tort claims. You’ll handle emerging risks; this team has been at the forefront of managing exposures from PFAS, opioids, and other cutting-edge issues. You’ll also be a coverage resource for Casualty adjusters, managers and underwriters. You’ll be supported by a management team that’s deeply invested in achieving the right outcomes for claims and that’s also invested in your success:
  
  

**You will:**  

Evaluate coverage on sophisticated insurance products
  
Hire and manage counsel to help evaluate coverage and to defend our insureds.
  
Assess damages with support of outside experts
  
Evaluate financial impact to AIG and to our insureds
  
Formulate and execute strategies for favorable claim resolution; negotiate with insureds and third parties.
  
Advise business partners concerning exposures and concerning potential product changes and enhancements.
  
Advise claims and business leaders on emerging risks.
  
  

What you’ll need to succeed
  
  

2+ years of Legal, Insurance, Construction Defect or Environmental experience preferred.
  
The ability to handle complex claims involving diverse coverage issues related to GL and Environmental policies.
  
Strong analytical and organizational skills, along with excellent communication, negotiation and investigation skills.
  
Veterans encouraged to apply.
  
  

Ready to take your career to the next level? We would love to hear from you.
  
  

For positions based in Jersey City, NJ the base salary range is $80,000-$100,000 and the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. A summary of benefits can be viewed here: 2024 Benefits Overview .
  
  

#LI-HB1
  
  

Welcome to a culture of belonging
  
  

We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
  
  

AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.
  
  

AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.
  
  

Enjoy benefits that take care of what matters
  
  

At AIG, our people are our greatest asset. We know how important it is to protect and invest in what’s most important to you. That is why we created our Total Rewards Program, a comprehensive benefits package that extends beyond time spent at work to offer benefits focused on your health, wellbeing and financial security—as well as your professional development—to bring peace of mind to you and your family.
  
  

Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world
  
  

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.

We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
  
  

AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.
  
  

AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com.
  
  

**Functional Area:**  

CL - Claims
  
  

**Estimated Travel Percentage (%):** Up to 25%
  
  

**Relocation Provided:** No

We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.
  
  

Welcome to a culture of belonging
  
  

We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.
  
  

AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.

title: Sales Executive, National Hardware Show
description:
Sales Executive, National Hardware Show  

Are you passionate about sales and building new business?  

Would you like to work for a global leader in the events industry?  

About our Team
NHS is the only industry event that unites the entire home improvement community. We provide the creativity and innovation for our customers to maximize visibility of their brand and products and connect with new and long-time buyers. The team works diligently to ensure the overall experience meets not only the expectation but exceeds exhibitor’s goals. NHS creates the atmosphere to align with peers and colleagues, discover the latest trends in the home improvement industry and explore new products and innovations on a global scale  

About the Role
The Sales Executive for NHS will join a highly experienced team with deep knowledge and experience within the home improvement industry. Working on this long-tenured event, you will prospect for new business and develop existing accounts within your territory. You will sell not only booth space, but promotional opportunities and digital products to help customers showcase their brand and exceed their goals for the show. This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced B2B salesperson who is able to manage a unique customer base, is highly consultative and skilled at building deep customer relationships.  

Responsibilities* Working with Sales Management to develop individual selling strategy. Generating prospects, pipeline and attainment of sales target for booth and media sales
* Adhering to all selling process best practices and standards. This will include inputting accurate and complete data, managing territory, daily output goals, and weekly strike rates.
* Monitoring industry trends, competitor activity, climate, players, distribution and issues to make recommendations regarding sales strategy on specific events
* Selling at competing shows and preparing show analysis and reports in an accurate and timely manner.
* Managing and broadening Exhibitor Prospect Lists and generate targeted lists to increase the probability of sales
* Forecasting revenue projections
* Obtaining signed contracts and ensuring that payments for all space reservations are made in full in a timely manner.

  

Requirements* Have a comprehensive understanding of the home improvement industry
* Enjoy cold calling and prospecting for new business
* Possess outstanding interpersonal skills; ability to communicate and present in a professional manner
* Demonstrate a value-based selling approach that delivers solutions for our clients
* Have well developed organizational skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work
* Be able to quickly learn and utilize sales data systems. Demonstrate proficiency with Microsoft Office, including Excel, Salesforce, Word and Power Point

  

Work in a way that works for you
We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organization. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.* Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive

  

Working for you
We know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:* Health Benefits: Comprehensive, multi-carrier program for medical, dental and vision benefits
* Retirement Benefits: 401(k) with match and an Employee Share Purchase Plan
* Wellbeing: Wellness platform with incentives, Headspace app subscription, Employee Assistance and Time-off Programs
* Short-and-Long Term Disability, Life and Accidental Death Insurance, Critical Illness, and Hospital Indemnity
* Family Benefits, including bonding and family care leaves, adoption and surrogacy benefits
* Health Savings, Health Care, Dependent Care and Commuter Spending Accounts
* Up to two days of paid leave each to participate in Employee Resource Groups and to volunteer with your charity of choice

  

About the Business
RX is a global leader in events and exhibitions, leveraging industry expertise, data, and technology to build businesses for individuals, communities, and organizations. With a presence in 25 countries across 42 industry sectors, RX hosts approximately 350 events annually. RX is committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all our people. RX empowers businesses to thrive by leveraging data-driven insights and digital solutions. RX is part of RELX, a global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers. For more information, visit www.rxglobal.com.  

Management Level
11 - Professional IC
We are an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form: https://forms.office.com/r/eVgFxjLmAK , or please contact 1-855-833-5120.
Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
**Find your passion!**


ACP is looking for friendly faces, positive attitudes, and playful personalities to bring our services to life. We offer opportunities for individuals at all stages of their careers the opportunity to join a team of like-minded individuals who are passionate about changing the lives of the children and families we serve. Come grow with us!

**What do we offer Part-Time BCBAs?**

* No non-competes!
* Competitive and consistent pay
* Flexible Schedules
* Caseload of no more than 10 clients
* Clinical support from experienced clinicians and collaboration.
* Opportunities to run training for RBTs and fellow clinicians. (We are a BACB ACE-approved provider.)

**Who are we?**


At Autism Care Partners (ACP), our mission is to empower families to reach their potential through early diagnosis and exceptional, innovative, interdisciplinary care. Our collaborative teams provide comprehensive care throughout all stages of a child’s development by offering these services: Applied Behavior Analysis, Speech Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Social Work, and Diagnostic Evaluations (service availability varies by location).

**What you’ll be doing at Autism Care Partners:**

* Manage caseload of no more than 10 clients
* Write and submit treatment plans and treatment plan renewals as required for each insurance authorization period
* Conduct initial skills assessment (e.g., VB-MAPP, ABLLS-R)
* Conduct FBAs and create behavior support plans
* Provide supervision and instruction to direct staff on correct implementation of treatment goals
* Supervise Registered Behavior Technicians (RBT)
* Ensure fidelity of each client’s treatment program and behavioral protocols
* Oversee data collection by direct staff
* Attend weekly team meetings
* Provide parent training and support

**Education and Experience**

* Education: master's degree
* Licensures: BCBA / LBA (in required states)
* Supervise Staff? Yes

**Physical Demands**

* Must be able to lift up to 30 lbs.
* Must be able to frequently assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) while attending to the needs of active children.
* Must be willing and able to utilize quick body movements as indicated in the Behavior Intervention Plan while working with challenging behavior.

**OUR MISSION**


Empowering families to reach their potential through early diagnosis and exceptional, innovative, interdisciplinary care.

**OUR VISION**


Transforming lives as a leader in innovative, integrated, and person-centered care.

**OUR VALUES**


Clinical excellence: Our services are evidence-based, outcome-driven, effective, and high quality. Collaborative: Our interdisciplinary teams work together to provide the best care. We create a relationship-driven, inclusive community where everyone’s ideas are welcome. Optimism and hope: We maintain a positive attitude and bring our clients hope. Inclusive: We value diversity and seek equity. We serve all communities, including many that are often underserved and under-resourced. Ethical: We act with integrity and transparency.

**Disclaimer**


The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work necessary to adequately execute the job responsibilities. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. All information is subject to change without notice.  

ACP123

title: Pickleball Attendant
description:
**Position Summary**


The Pickleball Attendant assists the Pickleball Coordinator and Tennis Manager in maintaining the day-to-day operations of the Pickleball Department. They schedule court time and educate members on Pickleball programs, lessons, and equipment. They provide exceptional customer service to encourage repeat business.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities**

* Greets, schedules court time and assists members in a friendly and professional manner
* Explains all Pickleball programs, services, and equipment to members and assists them with determining their individual needs
* Initiates, develops and maintains personalized relationships with members
* Assists in ensuring all pickleball facilities and equipment are clean, organized and in good working condition
* Promotes all Life Time programs, products, and services
* Ensures all daily billing is completed accurately and efficiently and reconciles the cash register at the end of a shift

**Minimum Required Qualifications**

* Working toward a High School Diploma or GED
* CPR and AED Certified within the first 30 days of hire
* 1 year of customer service experience

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Computer experience


Life Time is a place for everyone. As an organization, we are committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that respects and celebrates the unique contributions of each individual while ensuring we remain an equal opportunity employer that recruits, hires, trains and promotes based on merit and qualifications.

title: Life Time Swim Supervisor
description:
**Position Summary**


As the Aquatics Supervisor, you must enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. You will help members improve their swimming in our state-of-the-art recreational and lap pools, both indoors and out. This position assists in managing and training all Aquatics Department Team Members. You will offer great customer service and maintain the cleanliness and order of our Aquatics Facilities.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities**

* Ensures Aquatics Team Members offer a safe and friendly environment for all members
* Responds to member inquiries regarding Life Time programs, products, services, policies, and procedures in a professional and timely manner
* Ensures we have the highest level of programming

Promotes Life Time swim program  
* 

**Position Requirements**

* High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent
* 6 months of customer service experience
* 1 year coaching and/or swim instructor experience
* 1 year of lifeguarding experience
* 6 months of head guard or supervising experience
* Lifeguard and First Aid certified
* Successfully complete and pass all Life Time courses when hired
* Ability to work in a stationery position and move about the club for prolonged periods of time
* Ability to communicate and exchange information with guests who have inquiries about Life Time products and services
* Ability to swim 25 yards/meters without stopping
* Ability to routinely bend to raise more than 20 lbs

  



**Preferred Requirements**

* Some college or working towards a 4 year degree


Life Time is a place for everyone. ### **Job Description**

**JOB SUMMARY**
Editor who can work semi-independently in a promotional agency environment with assigned brand teams to enforce quality control across core editorial functions (editing, fact checking, proofreading).  

Differs from Senior Editor role in that Editor may not necessarily be able to fully speak to FDA/regulatory matters or negotiate with team regarding timing or process matters, may not have launch experience, or may not be equipped to serve as a mentor to other Editorial staff.  

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**
Compliance
Helps ensuring and enforcing compliance with OPDP/regulatory guidelines
Communication
Ensures daily communication to update internal team members on all aspects of projects
Proofreading
Maintains version control, ensures project file integrity, and verifies that requested changes have been accurately incorporated across rounds of project routing
Editing
Ensure correct spelling, grammatical accuracy, adherence to AMA/brand style, and consistency across brand deliverables
Fact checking
Verify factual information in projects vs supporting references  

**JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES*** Copyediting, proofreading, and fact checking on assigned accounts as well as other accounts as needed.
* Uses technologic tools to replace manual proofreading as appropriate.
* Generates and promptly updates style guide for assigned accounts.
* Ability to quickly master specifics of assigned accounts and product categories, as well as accommodate multiple assignments effectively.

* Exercises good evaluative and decision-making skills with appropriate follow-up.
* Establishes and communicates workload priorities to manager and second-shift staff.

Bachelors

N/A

1 year
Editorial experience in an agency environment or similar

Style Guidelines
Demonstrates knowledge of AMA guidelines
Computer Skills
Editing
Checking the spelling, text sizes, resolutions, color modes of graphics, review file separations. Making any additional changes necessary to insure proper and accurate printing.  


FDA Regulations
Familiarity with FDA regulations  


COMPETENCIES
Detail Orientation
Acute attention to detail, with an emphasis on consistency and continuity.  


Efficiency
Ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast paced environment.  


Grammar
Strong grammar skills  


Time Management
Carefully plans ahead to ensure tasks are undertaken and time is used efficiently  


Writing
Strong writing skills.  


OTHER INFORMATION
Typical hours are 9:00am-5:00pm, but the position may require work beyond those hours, including after hours or weekends, as needed or directed.
Second Shift: Typical hours are 4pm–midnight, but the position may require work beyond those hours, including after hours or weekends, as needed or directed.
All candidates must complete brief copy editing, fact checking, and proofreading tests on site in conjunction with interview.  


Salary  

$60,000 to $80,000 annually.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
**ABOUT US**


Sanctuary for Families is New York’s leading service provider and advocate for survivors of domestic violence, sex trafficking and related forms of gender violence. Every year, Sanctuary empowers thousands of adults and children to move from fear and abuse to safety and stability, transforming lives through a comprehensive range of services. We provide a range of wrap-around services to help survivors rebuild their lives in the aftermath of abuse, and work to end gender violence through three key strategies: direct services, outreach and training, and systems-change advocacy. Our services are available in 12 locations throughout New York City.

 **POSITION OVERVIEW**


The maintenance worker provides janitorial and cleaning services of all common areas at the Sarah Burke House.

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Maintains the facility common areas and apartments turn-overs.
* Cleans bathrooms floors and other common areas on a daily basis and as needed.
* Assists with deliveries such as pantry, donations and other supplies as needed.
* Arranges and/or moves furniture when necessary.
* Assist with set-up and clean-up for special events.
* Picks up mail at the post office on a daily bases.
* Paints as needed.
* Perform any other department or agency related duties or special project as directed.


* High School Diploma or GED preferred
* One year relevant experience maintenance experience required
* Able to operate small hand tools
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 100 lbs.
* Basic computer skills
* Fluency in both English and Spanish preferred

 **Budgeted Salary: $25.03 - $27.65/hr ($45,563 - $50,329 Annually); based on experience, pursuant to wage scale in accordance with collective bargaining agreement**

 **Position is Full-time, Hourly/Non-Exempt**

 **Work position is currently in-person full time; must be able to meet job location schedule obligations**

 **Benefits:**

* Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Employer retirement contribution
* Paid time off
* Flex spending account
* Student loan assistance
* Tuition reimbursement program
* Gym reimbursement program

 *All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, creed (religion), color, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, military status, age, disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, marital status or domestic violence victim status, and other categories protected under Federal, New York state or New York city laws. Sanctuary for Families follows the requirements of the Human Rights Law including with regard to non-discrimination on the basis of prior criminal conviction and prior arrest.*

 ***People of color, trans and gender non-conforming people, people with disabilities, and survivors of gender-based violence are strongly encouraged to apply.***

 *We recognize that the safety, healing and self-determination of survivors of domestic violence and related forms of gender violence is at the intersection of racial, gender, economic, immigrant, LGBTQ+, and disability justice, as well as many other critical issues. In order to realize our mission, Sanctuary strives to center DEI principles at every level of the organization and continues to deepen that commitment.*

title: Continuous Improvement Lead-Plainsboro, NJ.
description:
**Manufacturing Continuous Improvement Lead**

**Plainsboro, NJ, US**

**On-Site**

**CL 13**

  

As a Manufacturing Continuous Improvement Lead, you'll be at the heart of our plant's day-to-day excitement! With the amazing support of your team, you'll have endless opportunities to grow into a Manufacturing Professional and make a direct, positive impact on the quality of our products – all while helping to improve real lives. Get ready for a fun and energetic journey with us!

  

At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work to not only benefit our People, Customers & Communities but also drive business value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.

 **Your key responsibilities**

* Jump in and assist our awesome compounding operators with their routine tasks, from Start-up and Shut-Down to Operation Clean Up and Troubleshooting – making every day an adventure!
* Embrace and follow all safety guidelines to keep our team and environment safe, while complying with local, state, and federal laws.
* Dive into downtime/turnaround activities within the department to ensure we’re always ready to rock and roll with minimal start-up/ramp-up time!
* Lead the charge on cross-functional improvement projects using exciting lean tools and methodologies like value stream mapping, 5S, Kaizen events, root cause analysis, and standard work development.
* Inspire and empower your teammates by training and coaching them in SOPs, lean principles, tools, and techniques to create a vibrant culture of continuous improvement.
* Keep the momentum going by monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of training programs through assessments, feedback, and performance metrics, and make dynamic adjustments for ongoing awesomeness!

 **We bring**


* Endless opportunities for growth and advancement for those who embrace innovation and take initiative.
* Team up with gurus in health, nutrition, and beauty to drive groundbreaking progress.
* Partner with world-renowned brands to transform ideas into impactful solutions.
* Build a career that makes a significant impact on billions of lives, with the freedom to shape your own path.
* Dedication to creating brighter futures for customers, communities, people, and the planet.
* Thrive in a supportive setting where you're empowered to grow and contribute to meaningful change**.**

 **You bring**

* Bring your high school diploma, GED, or 5 years of manufacturing experience and join us for an exciting journey!
* Show off your knowledge of computers, calculators, PPE, sampling and testing equipment, and your sharp mathematical skills.
* Get hands-on with our equipment, operating it both remotely from a computer interface and locally – making every day a tech-savvy adventure!
* Stay organized and shine with your clear and effective communication skills, connecting seamlessly with both hourly and salaried team members.
* Put your knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, Access, and PowerPoint to good use in our dynamic environment.
* Demonstrate your awesome self-management and directing skills, leading the way to success!

  

dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: there’s a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.

  

As a committed equal opportunity employer, we ensure our recruitment practices are inclusive and fair. We encourage the recruitment of a diverse workforce, representative of the communities in which we work, by using inclusive language, diverse interview panels, diversified sourcing strategies. Selection is based on qualifications, competency, experience, performance history and fit with the team to advance fair and equitable opportunity.

  

Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, backgrounds, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

  

We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.

  

As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world’s growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than €12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life™ every day, everywhere, for billions of people.

  

Please note this is a direct search led by dsm-firmenich. We only accept applications from candidates, not from agencies nor subject to agency’s fees, percentages or similar.

title: Director of Marketing
description:
**Are you a marketing maverick who's grown tired of the constant hustle of running your own business, agency, or working as a fractional CMO, and craving the opportunity to channel your boundless talents into driving the exponential growth of an industry-leading company?**

  

Healthpreneur®, the world's leading company helping health professionals build scalable coaching businesses that transform more lives, is seeking a "best in class" Director of Marketing to spearhead our ambitious expansion plans.  



  

If you're a strategic visionary who lives and breathes direct response and brand marketing, with a proven track record of scaling online campaigns to new heights, we want you on our team.  



  

As our Director of Marketing, you'll be the architect behind our omni-channel marketing ecosystem, crafting high-converting campaigns that captivate our target audience, boost lead generation, and drive sales.  



  

Boasting a keen eye for innovation, a gift for persuasive copywriting, and an unparalleled understanding of the digital landscape, you'll elevate our brand, expand our reach, and take our business to the next level.  



  

Sound like your kind of challenge? Keep reading...

  

You are successful in this role when you have tripled our inbound call volume with qualified leads and substantially increased our social media following, subscriber base on Youtube, and have facilitated the conversion of that organic following into clients.

  

You will develop and optimize marketing strategies and campaigns, oversee the execution of all tactical elements with associated owned, earned and paid channels; associated digital/social platforms; new product launches; sales collateral; website content; and internal materials.

  

Additionally, you will oversee our in-house creative, content, and paid media team, leading the planning and delivery of best-in-class design and messaging, ensuring that everything is on brand (ie. voice, tone, philosophy) and improving important metrics.

  

**The Director of Marketing Role**

  

As our full time Director of Marketing for Healthpreneur®, you will oversee our marketing strategy, demand/lead generation, and growth-related activities to ensure we’re continually growing our client base, our monthly revenue, our social media and email following (and engagement), and our brand.

  

Our business model is very simple. Drive the right people (health professionals growing their coaching business online) to follow us, optin to our email list (via webinar or other helpful resource), AND ultimately book strategy calls with our sales team.

  

You will create and execute strategies for paid ads, organic and inbound marketing, social media, email marketing to consistently grow our revenue, number of engaged leads, calls booked, and overall social and email following.

  

As the Director of Marketing you will also lead team members in our marketing department and hold them accountable to agreed upon projects and objectives. You will conduct weekly 1-on-1 calls with your direct reports, attend our weekly leadership meetings, and our weekly team call.

  

Your success will be measured by your ability to generate more qualified leads that allow us to generate more sales appointments and ultimately help us grow new client revenue each month. You will also be responsible for helping us grow the Healthpreneur® brand across all social channels through the omnipresent distribution of our content in streamlined, organized, and high volume fashion.

 **RESPONSIBILITIES**

  

* Oversee the strategy and execution of new client acquisition from social, organic, email, and paid traffic sources.
* Run our ads inside Facebook ads manager (not mandatory but very desirable as it would allow us not to have to bring on a separate media buyer)
* Create promotional campaigns (and marketing assets) that drive new business (from email, social, etc…) and systemize them so we can repurpose them (if successful in the future).
* Oversee and deploy our weekly email marketing with a healthy mix of content and promotion (most content will be provided from our copywriter but you should have the ability to whip up a promotional campaign when needed).
* Be able to write (if needed) emails, Facebook ads, VSLs, and/or web/landing pages that connect with our audience (in our voice) and convert.
* Always have split tests running inside Visual Website Optimizer across all levels of our funnel(s), always hunting for conversion improvements.
* Develop clearly-defined quarterly plans that help us scale our client acquisition and get the right people on board to make it happen.
* Measure, analyze, and optimize digital media and prepare recommendations for improved performance.
* Create and optimize our current offer (through funnel CRO, introducing new angles, etc…) that generate more leads as well as convert our existing audience into potential clients.
* Work closely with our media buyer (unless that’s also you), copywriters, graphic designers, and video editors to assemble all necessary marketing assets in a timely manner and ensure our KPIs are being met.
* Oversee content strategy to continue growing our Youtube channel and social media following.
* Be mindful of project/task budgets to produce results as profitably as possible, without compromising quality.
* Understand our messaging, philosophy, core content pillars, and our client avatar as closely as you know your own family members.
* Have a very intimate understanding of our coaching program and the success our clients are achieving so you can incorporate client testimonials and social proof into our social strategy.
* Be able analyze data and assess how effective various campaigns and angles are performing, so that we can identify which messages and ideas are most effective for future content.
* Have a deep understanding of our marketing assets (ie. webinars, trainings, whitepapers, etc…) so they can be leveraged to grow our list and get clients.
* Keep an open line of communication with our sales team to keep a pulse on the quality of leads booking calls (and their conversions).
* Study our Healthpreneur® Brand Identity document and related Company Culture documents to be 100% clear on the company vision, core values, ideal clients, important processes, and overall business model
* Attend Weekly Sync (team meeting), weekly 1-on-1 meeting with CEO, monthly and quarterly strategic planning meetings.
* Hire, lead, coach, and develop your direct reports (on the marketing team) so that you can get the best performance out of all team members.
* Conduct weekly or bi-weekly 1-on-1 meetings with your direct reports to ensure they’re fully supported and feel safe, trusted, and valued in their roles and working environments.

  


**RESULTS**

 **Help us get to at least $30k/day in ad spend on Facebook/Instagram while meeting the following metrics:**



* 30-day cash collected ROAS of at least 2x (current ad spend is about $10k/day at 1.5x cash collected ROAS)


* 40 calls booked per day at less than $700/call booked (currently - 10 calls booked/day at $900/call booked)
  


**Generate 1,000+ Enrollment Calls Booked Per Month (With Qualified Leads)**


* Through a combination of paid ads, organic traffic, email list, etc…
* Currently, we book about 350 calls per month

  


**Grow Sales Opportunities (Qualified Leads, Calls Booked) From Email and Organic Sources To Match (Or Exceed) Our Cold Traffic Acquisition Revenue**


* “Lead-to-Client” rate target = 1.5% (currently 1.2%) - good measure of our ability to nurture our list
* Oversee the continued growth of our Youtube and Instagram following knowing that these “warm” audiences will become HUGE opportunities for our business.
* Currently, 80% of our sales come from paid traffic and 20% from organic/social.

 **REQUIREMENTS**

  

* You have at least 4+ years tactical and strategic experience in DIGITAL MARKETING with a proven track record helping grow an online company (ideally service or coaching based) beyond $10 million in revenue.
* 2+ years managing and developing teams in marketing (working with media buyers, CROs, content creators, etc..) and excellent project management skills
* Full time and 100% all-in with our company. No side gigs or other consulting work.
* English is your first language and you have excellent oral and written communication skills.
* You live in North America
* You must have expert level understanding of Facebook ads and a track record of having scaled campaigns/accounts to $500k (or more) in monthly spend - PROFITABLY and CONSISTENTLY (not just once). Google/Youtube ads experience is a big plus.
* You have a player-coach mindset. You have experience and capabilities that enable you to mentor and develop our junior marketers and you can also roll up your sleeves and get some of the heavy lifting done such as writing high-converting copy..
* You have the energy, focus, and willingness to work in a fast-growing culture and help our company grow to beyond $50M in revenue (within 2-3 years), while impacting the businesses of 1000s of health professionals and the health of millions of people.
* You are an IDEA MACHINE - you can connect seemingly unrelated dots to come up with big ideas and hooks that captivate attention, generate demand, and create new breakthroughs for the business. And you have a strong ability to clearly organize, plan, and communicate your ideas so that they get executed in a methodical and effective manner (rather than just shooting from the hip on a whim).
* You are VERY proficient creating and using spreadsheets (Google sheets) to analyze your team’s marketing performance such as ad spend, CPMs, clicks, and conversions. We are heavily data driven and you must be as well.
* You LOVE DATA and understand how to track and improve campaigns based on important metrics.
* You have sharp copywriting skills and you understand conversion rate optimization. When you look at an offer (or marketing asset) you can see the gaps and opportunities to make it stronger based on how the message and/or page layout/design can be improved for better conversions.
* You have a DEEP understanding of human psychology and the forces that drive people to make decisions. You’ve read books like Pre-Suasion, Influence, and Predictably Irrational which has furthered your obsession with how to persuade people (in their best interest).
* You are a very good problem solver and are able to figure things out. You can read between the lines, think critically, and create the best course of action to improve a situation when needed.
* You have excellent copywriting skills and a strong understanding of how to influence people to take action.
* You’ve successfully launched products/programs to market with great success and know exactly how to create demand and build desire.
* The secret code is HP2026
* You have a good eye for visual layout (CRO) and beautiful, simple design.
* You are a SELF-STARTER who loves to work independently (and remotely) with little or no daily supervision, yet still be part of a team that thrives on open communication, clear outcomes, and accountability.
* You are an excellent and persuasive communicator and great at storytelling to consumers.
* You are a people person and know how to support, coach, and get the most out of those you work with.
* You are very well organized, structured, and efficient
* You have excellent time management skills, including prioritizing, scheduling, and adapting as necessary to the fast pace at which we move.
* You can handle a high volume of work, manage pressure well, and get things done quickly with attention to detail.
* You are technically proficient and have an excellent understanding and experience using Instagram, Facebook (ads), Facebook messenger, LinkedIn, Twitter, Youtube, Gmail, Asana, Slack, Convertri, Ontraport, Hyros, and Google Docs/Sheets.
* You are OBSESSED with growing and getting better. You voraciously consume content (marketing and sales related podcasts, books, courses, etc…) to help you sharpen your sword.
* You have a high intolerance for “average” and working with B-players. You want to be the best at what you do, produce the best possible work, and only work with the best people. And you don’t shy away from having hard conversations with those who don’t meet those standards.
* You’ve studied (or worked with) some of the marketing greats like Alex Hormozi, Ogilvy, Eugene Schwartz, Brian Kurtz, Frank Kern, Ryan Deiss (Digital Marketer), Perry Belcher, Dan Kennedy, Joe Polish, Russell Brunson, Ezra Firestone, Dean Jackson, etc… (if you don’t know who these people are, this isn’t the right role for you).

 **About Our Company - Healthpreneur**

 **Growth. Owner-Like Work Ethic. Speed.**

  

These are essential traits to thrive as a team member at Healthpreneur®.

  

We are the leading coaching and training company for helping health professionals and coaches get clients and scale their coaching businesses online…without the grind.

  

We are a remote, high performance team with a culture that is obsessed with excellence.

  

In a world where most businesses (and the people within them) are average at best, we refuse to join their ranks.

  

We are obsessed with helping our clients make their dreams happen in the service of others, while creating a company that is an industry leader for decades to come.

  

We cannot achieve this vision without incredible people.

  

But, if you’re looking for a cushy job with tons of time off, healthcare benefits, ping pong tables, and the ability to “switch off” when you leave the office, this isn’t for you.

  

If you get overwhelmed easily and your life is a mess, this isn’t for you.

  

If you strive to do the bare minimum or think that simply getting tasks done is doing a great job, then this isn’t for you.

  

Working at Healthpreneur® requires a "winner" mindset. We go above and beyond, not because we have to but because we want to. It’s who we are.

  

We’re looking for high-performers who are so effective that they can do the work of 2 people.

  

We are a performance-based company that rewards hitting outcomes, not completing tasks.

  

On our team, 80% of success is NOT just “showing up”. To be successful with us, you must actually move the needle by helping our business generate more revenue, become more profitable, or help our clients succeed - that’s it.

  

This isn’t a place to work if you’re looking for a job, but rather a fulfilling career where you can grow to your fullest potential.

  

In our minds, work-life balance is a fairy tale. The reality is that your work affects your life and your life affects your work. That's why we practice work-life integration.

  

We believe in living a good life. A life built on freedom. But freedom doesn’t mean doing nothing and living the 4-hour workweek leaving you bored out of your mind.

  

For us, freedom means being able to live life on your terms and contribute in meaningful ways through work that inspires and lights you up, while enjoying life along the way (not when you retire).

  

At Healthpreneur®, we work hard - not because we have to but because we want to.

  


We don’t expect you to work 24/7 but you are expected to do what needs to be done to move the needle in your role.

  

If you’re selected to work with us, you are not accepting a 9-5, “punch in, punch out” job. And we are certainly not a company where you’d expect to completely disconnect every weekend…especially if clients or team members are counting on you to keep the ball rolling.

  

Although we encourage setting boundaries and creating space to relax and recharge, when you love what you do, you don’t need to escape from work. Doing work you love feels like a vacation. And when you do have some time off, you’re still thinking about your work because you’re obsessed with it (in a healthy way).

  

Again, this isn't a job. This is a passion. This is a career with incredible growth potential with a company that is transforming a broken healthcare model.

  

We’re looking for winners who are hungry, competitive, and driven.

  

Is that you?

  

Our culture is based on the premise “Be Great. Do Great” - regardless of location. Since our team is virtual, it’s about how we show up day after day, how we behave and treat one another in and outside of work. It’s about being a self-starter who does what’s needed to get done and who is held accountable to specifically defined targets without having a manager breathing over your shoulder.

  

It’s about our shared values and how we communicate those values to each other and our clients. Regular two-way feedback, collaboration, and transparency within our team and our clients isn’t something we thought would sound good. It’s what we BELIEVE in and what we PRACTICE.

  

Strong culture inside the business equates to strong culture outside the business (with our clients) which is probably why we have grown so quickly  



  

We live and breathe the following 3 core values:

 **Speed is King**



Getting things done quickly is more important than doing them perfectly. By moving quickly, we expedite our learning and fast track our success.

 **Owner-Like Commitment**



We are dedicated to doing great work and going above and beyond because the business' success (and that of our clients) is our success.

 **Driven to Grow**



We are voracious learners and we love a good challenge because it brings out our innate desire to grow and become our best.

  

If this sounds like home, and you fit the bill for the writing position (as described above), then click the "apply for this job" button to take the next step.

  

If you fit the bill, then **click the "apply for this job" button** on this page to submit your application today.  

  

We look forward to hearing from you.
